DOC.detailed_description: Rationale : Postpartum haemorrhage ( PPH ) common cause maternal death worldwide . The active management third stage labour ( AMTSL ) recognize effective strategy prevent morbidity mortality associate PPH reduce blood loss . AMTSL include provision uterotonic drug , control cord traction , delay cord clamp cutting , massage uterus , monitor uterine tonus . Although professional guideline recommend step AMTSL perform health professional , reality health professional understaffed hospital many low- middle income country ( LMICs ) necessitate task-shifting final AMTSL component patient . Yet , whether uterine tonus assessment yield effect perform patient midwife formally evaluate . Objective : To determine whether difference effectiveness routine uterine tonus assessment ( every 15 minute , 2 hour ) perform midwife self-administered patient incidence postpartum haemorrhage . mean blood loss , maternal neonatal outcome . Study design : Randomized intervention study . Study population : Pregnant woman admit labour Korle Bu Teaching Hospital , Accra , Ghana Intervention : intervention group receive uterine tonus assessment every 15 minute 2 hour midwife , control group continue current practice self-assessment patient education regular monitoring midwife . Main study parameters/endpoints : post-partum haemorrhage ( > 500 ml blood loss ) , severe postpartum haemorrhage ( > 1000 ml blood loss ) , mean blood loss , maternal neonatal outcome . Nature extent burden risk associate participation , benefit group relatedness : Patients receive standard midwifery obstetric care , access emergency obstetric intervention . All step AMTSL perform , exemption last step uterine tonus assessment woman randomize receive intervention current practice care . Risk associate intervention discomfort external assessment . Data obtain record book ward . Women ask informed consent prior participation . This study approve Ethical en Protocol Review Committee University Ghana Medical School Medical Ethical Research Committee University Medical Center Utrecht .
